title._content: First Community Church - Lincoln Road Chapel, 1917

description._content: In 1909 a small, nondenominational group of men and women began to meet in Grandview Heights. They joined the Congregational Church organization in 1910. Under the leadership of Reverend Fred L. Brownlee, the Grandview Congregational Church strived to be a church where all denominations could unite. It considered itself "The Church With the Open Door". In 1915, Reverend Oliver C. Weist, a graduate of Ohio State University and Columbia University, took over leadership. Reverend Weist convinced his church to leave the Congregational church organization and become the First Community Church of Grandview. Membership at that time was 297. Growth in the congregation led to the building of a church on Cambridge Boulevard that was dedicated on June 3, 1926. In 1963, the church built a retirement community named First Community Village on 30 acres of the former Miller Farm. Together with Trinity M. E. Church, The First Community Church legally blocked additional churches from being built in Grandview Heights until 1934. This image available online at the UA Archives: ua-archives.cdmhost.com/u?/p4036coll9,209 ---------------------------------------- Identifier hinw02p010i01 Date (yyyy-mm-dd): c. 1917-12 Original Dimensions: 12.8 cm x 7.8 cm Format: Black and White Halftone Photograph Source: Norwester, December 1917, page 10 Original Publisher: Upper Arlington Community (Ohio) Location/s: Grandview Heights (USA, Ohio, Franklin County) Repository: Upper Arlington Historical Society Digital Publisher: UA Archives - Upper Arlington Public Library Credit: UA Archives - Upper Arlington Public Library (Repository: UA Historical Society)
